posts.cooked:
Hi NVidia. I noticed that in the DGX Dashboard settings the sharing of usage data with NVidia is turned on by default. Shouldn’t this be an Opt-In option? At least for the EU region.
But personally I think it should always be Opt-In, or at least be notified about it when you run the app the first time.
I think it really should be. I also noticed that when i manually toggled it off during start up, it was actually toggled back on automatically in the settings.

I just checked the telemetry settings again in DGX Dashboard and the ‘Analytics and Usage’ option was enabled again. Even though I turned it off two days ago.

Actually, when you turn it off and confirm the change. When I then refresh the dashboard page, it is showing as turned on again. So it never turns off.

@NVidia, can this be fixed?

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked:
Hi, this is a visual UI bug that we are working on fixing in a future update. We have confirmed that if you switch to turn off telemetry it will not send anything.

Unable to disable telemetry through DGX Dashboard (or UI bug) DGX Spark / GB10
Under http://127.0.0.1:11000/settings > System tab you can uncheck the Analytics and data usage and it remains unchecked - as long as you don’t refresh the page. [image] and after a refresh [image] I am not clear whether or not it is actually disabled, whether it is just a UI bug or not.

link_counts.title: Unable to disable telemetry through DGX Dashboard (or UI bug)

posts.cooked:
Telemetry should have arrived auto “off” with a pop for consent

Finding out later that it was auto “on” is not cool

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: The telemetry option is set when you go through the OOBE when setting up the Spark for the first time. Telemetry does not automatically send unless you choose it to.
I declined on the OOBE screen but it was toggled on even thought I declined on both Sparks

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: Yeah as I said, this is a visual glitch which we are fixing, but your choice was kept.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
